headline.main: SHIPPING -- MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIMF.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, March 28 -- Romulo Betancourt, former President of Venezuela, today communicated to United Nations delegations a letter of protest accusing the present Venezuelan regime of violating human rights, destroying freedom of the press and...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, March 28 -- Romulo Betancourt, former President of Venezuela, today communicated to United Nations delegations a letter of protest accusing the present Venezuelan regime of violating human rights, destroying freedom of the press and employing the "Hitlerian system of holding hostages."
docs.abstract: ex-Pres Betancourt revs US relations with deposed and new Govt

headline.main: VENEZUELAN URGES REGIME'S CENSURE; Ex-President Betancourt Asks U. N. Assembly to Investigate New 'Hitlerian System'

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: X Cugat cancels scheduled concert because of Argentine musicians' union opposition
docs.abstract: X Cugat cancels scheduled concert because of Argentine musicians' union opposition

headline.main: CUGAT CANCELS CONCERT; Argentine Trip Off Because of Union Opposition There

docs.snippet: Miguel Czerniak of Palestine entrenched himself in third place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday by winning the black side of a French defense from Franz Benkoe of Hungary, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Miguel Czerniak of Palestine entrenched himself in third place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday by winning the black side of a French defense from Franz Benkoe of Hungary, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: CZERNIAK SETS BACK BENKOE IN CHESS PLAY

docs.snippet: Several hundred surplus propeller-driven aircraft win be part of the first year's consignment of arms and equipment to be transferred to western European nations after the signing of the Atlantic pact.

headline.main: Aircraft for Europe; Transfer of Surplus U.S. War Planes to Western Nations to Follow Pact

docs.snippet: Dr. Edward Lasker of New York lost to Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires in the fifteenth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, giving the South American a much-needed point to retain the lead, according to a report from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Edward Lasker of New York lost to Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires in the fifteenth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, giving the South American a much-needed point to retain the lead, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ROSSETTO DOWNS LASKER AT CHESS; Wins After 32 Moves to Keep the Lead at Mar del Plata -- Guimard Beats Cruz

docs.snippet: Winning his adjourned games from the twelfth and fourteenth rounds of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires yesterday established himself firmly in first place with a score of 12 1/2 -- 2 1/2,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Winning his adjourned games from the twelfth and fourteenth rounds of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires yesterday established himself firmly in first place with a score of 12 1/2 -- 2 1/2, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ROSSETTO SETS BACK TWO RIVALS IN CHESS

docs.snippet: Gen. Mark W. Clark declared yesterday that he knew nothing of reports that he might be transferred from his command of the United States Sixth Army in San Francisco to a post in Berlin or Moscow.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. Mark W. Clark declared yesterday that he knew nothing of reports that he might be transferred from his command of the United States Sixth Army in San Francisco to a post in Berlin or Moscow.

headline.main: THE SIXTH ARMY COMMANDER RETURNS FROM CRUISE

docs.snippet: With a draw in eighteen moves against Paul Michel of Germany in the sixteenth and semi-final round, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires attained a score of 13 -- 3 in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, thereby leading...
docs.lead_paragraph: With a draw in eighteen moves against Paul Michel of Germany in the sixteenth and semi-final round, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires attained a score of 13 -- 3 in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, thereby leading the field of eighteen by a full point, according to a report received from Argentina.

headline.main: ROSSETTO, MICHEL DRAW IN 18 MOVES; Argentine Chess Player Leads by Point in Mar del Pinta Event -- Eliskases Wins

docs.snippet: Although defeated for the first time in the seventeenth and final round yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires finished in first place in the international chess masters tournament concluded at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although defeated for the first time in the seventeenth and final round yesterday, Hector Rossetto of Buenos Aires finished in first place in the international chess masters tournament concluded at Mar del Plata, according to a report received from Argentina.

headline.main: CZERNIAK DEFEATS ROSSETTO IN CHESS; But Buenos Aires Expert Wins Mar del Plata Tourney as Eliskases Also Loses
